articles.title: WATCH | Jupiter's aurora triggered a heat wave, solving a mystery that puzzled scientists - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: A heat wave on Jupiter helped astronomers solve the planet's "energy crisis" mystery. Watch the video of an aurora heating the planet.
articles.content:
Jupiter is weirdly hot.
For a planet so far from the sun, its upper atmosphere is a boiling 400 degrees Celsius (750 Fahrenheit). That's about the same as Earth's upper atmosphere.
